response_parsed.title: Testing HTTP status codes with pytest (Python 3.12+)
response_parsed.summary: This guide provides a comprehensive explanation on how to test HTTP status codes using pytest, the popular Python testing framework, in Python 3.12+.
key_points: Leverage Python's built-in `requests` library for sending HTTP requests during tests.
Assert on the returned HTTP status code to validate expected responses.
Use pytest fixtures for setting up and teardown of common resources (e.g., test servers).
Employ pytest markers to group related tests based on their intended HTTP status codes.
version_notes: Python 3.12+ is required for this tutorial.
Ensure you have the `requests` library installed: `pip install requests`.
caveats: Remember to start and stop any test servers in your fixture's teardown section.
Avoid hard-coding URLs or endpoints as they may vary across different test environments.
